title: User Registration with Valid Data
description: Verify that a new user can register successfully with valid information and receives appropriate role assignment.

steps.description: Navigate to the user registration page.
Fill out the registration form with valid user data and select a valid role (ADMIN, INVESTIGATOR or COMMUNITY).
Submit the registration form.
Verify that the system creates the user account successfully and assigns the selected role.
Verify that a confirmation message or email is sent if applicable.

title: User Login with Correct Credentials
description: Check that a registered user can login successfully using valid credentials and receive a JWT token.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Input correct username/email and password.
Submit the login form.
Verify that login is successful and a valid JWT token is issued.
Verify that user role information is included in the token and properly accessible.

title: Failed Login with Incorrect Credentials
description: Ensure login fails with an appropriate error message when user enters invalid username or password.

steps.description: Go to the login page.
Enter invalid username/email or password.
Attempt to login.
Verify that login is rejected and an error message is displayed.

title: Role-Based Access Control Verification
description: Verify that users can access only features permitted for their assigned role (ADMIN, INVESTIGATOR, COMMUNITY).

steps.description: Login as ADMIN.
Verify ADMIN can access user management, project management, and system settings.
Logout and login as INVESTIGATOR.
Verify INVESTIGATOR can create and manage own projects and scientific products but not user management.
Logout and login as COMMUNITY.
Verify COMMUNITY role has limited access, mainly to view and collaborate but cannot edit projects or manage users.

title: Create Research Project with Valid Data
description: Ensure an authorized user can create a new research project specifying all required fields including state, dates, budget, collaborators, and associated products.

steps.description: Login as ADMIN or INVESTIGATOR.
Navigate to project creation interface.
Fill out the project creation form with valid data.
Submit the form to create the project.
Verify the project is created correctly with all fields stored.
Verify collaborators and associated scientific products are linked properly.

title: Update Existing Project Data
description: Verify that authorized users can update details of an existing project, including state changes, budget, dates and collaborator roles.

steps.description: Login with ADMIN or INVESTIGATOR credentials.
Select an existing project from the project list.
Edit project fields such as state, budget, deadlines, and collaborators.
Save changes.
Verify that updated details are persisted accurately.

title: Delete Research Project
description: Validate that authorized users can delete a research project and that associated entities handle deletion gracefully.

steps.description: Login as ADMIN.
Choose an existing project eligible for deletion.
Delete the project.
Verify the project no longer appears in listings.
Ensure that related scientific products and collaborator links are either reassigned, archived or deleted according to system rules.

title: Upload and Organize Files in Cloudflare R2
description: Test the file upload system supports multiple document formats, stores files correctly in Cloudflare R2, and associates files properly with projects or products.

steps.description: Login as INVESTIGATOR or ADMIN.
Navigate to file upload interface linked to a project or scientific product.
Upload files of varying types (PDF, DOCX, images).
Verify files are stored on Cloudflare R2 successfully.
Check that metadata including upload date, uploader, and association are recorded accurately.
Download a previously uploaded file.
Verify file downloads correctly and matches the uploaded content.

title: Scientific Product Management with Multiple Authorship Roles
description: Validate creation, update, and association of scientific products with correct metadata and multiple authorship roles (author, co-author, editor, reviewer).

steps.description: Login as INVESTIGATOR.
Create a new scientific product and input all required metadata.
Assign multiple contributors with various authorship roles.
Submit and save the product.
Verify the product is listed with proper metadata and authorship roles.
Edit the product to update metadata and contributor roles.
Verify updates are applied correctly.

title: Automated Evaluation and Scoring of Research Projects
description: Confirm the scoring system automatically evaluates projects based on criteria such as completeness, collaboration, productivity, impact, innovation, and timeline, producing accurate scores and AI recommendations.

steps.description: Ensure at least one research project exists with various states and data completeness.
Trigger evaluation algorithm via system interface or API.
Verify the system generates scores reflecting project completeness and other criteria.
Check for AI-generated recommendations or advisories related to project improvements or risks.

title: Smart Alert System Generates Proper Notifications
description: Verify that the alert engine monitors project statuses and triggers appropriate alerts for risk conditions, productivity issues, and improvement opportunities.

steps.description: Create or simulate projects with risk factors or milestones overdue.
Allow alert system to evaluate project data.
Verify that alerts are generated and visible on dashboards for authorized users.
Confirm alert notifications respect user role permissions and deliver actionable information.

title: Real-Time Dashboard Auto-refresh and Metrics Accuracy
description: Ensure the system dashboard refreshes automatically every 2 minutes and displays accurate, up-to-date metrics on projects, evaluations, alerts, and system status.

steps.description: Login to dashboard as authorized user.
Verify that dashboard data refreshes automatically every 2 minutes without user intervention.
Change project data externally (via API or admin tools).
Confirm updated data appears on the dashboard after refresh.

title: Collaborator Management with Role Assignments and Permissions
description: Validate that users with permissions can add, update, and remove collaborators on projects and assign appropriate roles with defined permissions.

steps.description: Login as ADMIN or INVESTIGATOR.
Select a project and access collaborator management.
Add a new collaborator and assign a role.
Verify the collaborator is added with correct role and permissions.
Modify collaborator's role.
Verify role changes and respective permissions update correctly.
Remove a collaborator.
Verify the collaborator no longer has access to the project.

title: RESTful API Security and Coverage
description: Ensure all RESTful API endpoints enforce authentication and authorization using JWT, support CRUD operations for users, projects, products, alerts, and scoring, and return appropriate status codes and error messages.

steps.description: Attempt access to secured API endpoints without authentication.
Verify accesses are denied with 401 Unauthorized response.
Login to obtain JWT token.
Access API endpoints with valid token for each user role.
Verify each role can only access permitted endpoints and actions.
Perform CRUD operations for projects, products, alerts, and scoring via API.
Verify responses include correct data, status codes, and error handling.

title: Frontend UI Responsiveness and Usability
description: Verify the frontend interface built with React, TypeScript, and TailwindCSS is responsive across devices and user-friendly for all roles.

steps.description: Open the application UI on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.
Check that layouts adapt appropriately to different screen sizes.
Log in as different user roles and navigate dashboards and forms.
Verify UI elements are accessible, intuitive, and features render correctly.
Perform common actions such as creating projects, uploading files, and managing collaborators.
Ensure no visual bugs or usability issues appear.

title: TypeScript Type Safety Enforcement
description: Confirm that all TypeScript type definitions and interfaces for core entities (users, projects, products) are accurately used throughout the system to prevent runtime type errors.

steps.description: Review compiled application for TypeScript errors or warnings.
Verify no type mismatches occur in communication between frontend, backend, and data entities.
Manipulate data using interfaces and attempt invalid data inputs.
Ensure type validations prevent invalid data processing.

title: Error Handling on File Upload Failure
description: Verify proper error messages and recovery options are presented when file uploads to Cloudflare R2 fail due to network or format issues.

steps.description: Attempt to upload a corrupted or unsupported file format.
Verify a clear error message is shown describing the issue.
Simulate network failure during file upload.
Ensure upload fails gracefully and retry or cancel options are offered.

title: Project Timeline and Budget Edge Case Testing
description: Test project creation and update handling of edge cases for dates (past, future, invalid ordering) and budgets (zero, negative, very large values).

steps.description: Try creating a project with start date after end date.
Verify validation prevents submission and shows appropriate error.
Try inputting budget as zero, negative, and very large number.
Confirm that budget validations accept or reject values according to rules.

title: API Rate Limiting and Request Throttling
description: Validate that the API enforces rate limiting to protect system resources and prevent abuse.

steps.description: Send a high volume of API requests in short time from a single client.
Verify the system responds with HTTP 429 Too Many Requests or appropriate error after threshold is met.
Check that service remains stable and recovers after throttling.

title: Collaborator Authorization Boundary Testing
description: Ensure collaborators cannot perform actions outside their assigned permissions or access data from projects they are not part of.

steps.description: Login as a collaborator with restricted permissions.
Attempt to access or modify projects where the user is not assigned.
Verify access is denied and actions cannot be performed.
Attempt to escalate permissions via API calls.
Confirm unauthorized permission changes are rejected.
